frontend.handlers package¶

Submodules¶

frontend.handlers.echo module¶

Handles echo topic PubSub connections. Generally, manages the WebSocket echo/chat system.

class frontend.handlers.echo.EchoHandler(consumer)¶

Bases: frontend.handlers.base.Handler

Takes messages and broadcasts it to all channels connected to the echo channel layer group.

reserved_names = ['system']¶
usernames = []¶
disconnect(code)¶

The connection was closed. :return:

handle(content)¶

Received some content with topic echo specified :param content: :return:

subscribe(content)¶

Tries to perform an initial subscription with user-provided data :param content: :return:

broadcast(content)¶

Broadcasts the given message to the entire room :param content: :return:

send_to_group(message)¶

Sends a message to the “echo” channel layer group :param message: :return:

echo_new_user(event)¶

Receives channel layer group notifications for new users :param event: :return:

echo_del_user(event)¶

Receives channel layer group notifications for leaving users :param event: :return:

echo_message(event)¶

Receives channel layer group notifications for new messages :param event: :return:

frontend.handlers.notify module¶

Handles notify topic PubSub connections. Lets clients know when some Django model has changed.

class frontend.handlers.notify.NotifyHandler(consumer)¶

Bases: frontend.handlers.base.Handler

Handles subscriptions to Django model changes for the current Consumer.

handle(content)¶

Received some content with topic notify :param content: :return:

notify_change(event)¶

Receives channel layer group notifications for changes to the model objects :param event: :return:

notify_delete(event)¶

Receives channel layer group notifications for changes to the model objects :param event: :return:

class frontend.handlers.notify.NotifySubscribeSerializer(instance=None, data=<class 'rest_framework.fields.empty'>, **kwargs)¶

Bases: rest_framework.serializers.Serializer

For validating a subscription request to a given model

create(validated_data)¶

static validate_type(value)¶

Module contents¶

Topic handlers for frontend Pub/Sub connections.

Handler class names correspond to the topics they each listen to, after the topic string has been run through the normalisation in consumers.get_handler_name.

Handler classes will be initialised the first time a Consumer receives a message with its topic, and should define a handle method that takes the message as an argument.

The Handler’s disconnect method will also be called when the Consumer’s connection is closed.
